response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations of perfection, it's driving me insane!"
"Why does society make me feel like I have to be flawless in every aspect of my life?"
"I'm starting to lose sight of who I really am in this constant pursuit of perfection."
"It feels like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of trying to meet societal standards that keep changing."
"I'm becoming overwhelmed trying to live up to the unrealistic ideals set by society."
"I'm exhausted from constantly comparing myself to others and feeling like I'm never good enough."
"The pressure to be perfect is making me doubt my own worth and abilities."
"I'm starting to question if there's even such a thing as 'perfect' or if it's just an illusion."
"I feel like I'm losing my sanity trying to fit into society's narrow definition of perfection."
"It's becoming harder and harder to distinguish between what's real and what's just society's unrealistic expectations."
